documents.content:
# California Real Estate Salesperson License Requirements (2026)

## Department of Real Estate (DRE)

### Basic Requirements
- **Age:** 18 years or older
- **Honesty:** Must meet DRE's honesty requirements
- **Education:** 135 hours (3 college-level courses)

### Required Pre-License Courses (135 hours total)
1. **Real Estate Principles** (45 hours) - MANDATORY
2. **Real Estate Practice** (45 hours) - MANDATORY
   - Must include implicit bias and fair housing components (SB 1495)
3. **One Elective** (45 hours) - Choose from:
   - Real Estate Appraisal
   - Property Management
   - Real Estate Finance
   - Real Estate Economics
   - Legal Aspects of Real Estate
   - Real Estate Office Administration
   - Escrow
   - Mortgage Loan Brokering
   - Computer Applications in Real Estate
   - Common Interest Developments

### Costs to Become Licensed
| Item | Cost |
|------|------|
| Pre-License Courses (online/school) | $125 - $700 |
| State Examination Fee | $100 |
| License Application Fee | $350 |
| Live Scan Fingerprinting | $49 + rolling fee |
| **TOTAL INVESTMENT** | **$635 - $1,210** |

### Examination Details
- **Questions:** 150 multiple choice
- **Time:** 3 hours 15 minutes
- **Passing Score:** 70% (105 correct out of 150)
- **Pass Rate:** Approximately 50%
- **Test Locations:** Fresno, La Palma, Oakland, Sacramento, San Diego
- **Scheduling:** https://secure.dre.ca.gov

### After Passing the Exam
1. Apply for license within 1 year of passing
2. Associate with a licensed broker (cannot work independently)
3. Complete onboarding with broker
4. Begin practicing real estate

### Official URLs
- DRE Main: https://www.dre.ca.gov
- Salesperson Requirements: https://www.dre.ca.gov/examinees/requirementssales.html
- eLicensing Portal: https://secure.dre.ca.gov
- Approved Schools: https://secure.dre.ca.gov/publicasp/cestatutory.asp
